snippet: The fate of François Hollande’s young presidency rests largely on legislative elections that begin Sunday, as he seeks a large majority and the right tries to deny him one.
abstract: France's upcoming parliamentary elections are expected to determine the extent and pace of reform under President Francois Hollande; deeply unpopular Nicolas Sarkozy has stepped aside, but his party, the center-right Union for a Popular Movement, is trying to beat back the tide and deny the Socialists and their leftist allies a large majority in Parliament; at the same time, Marine Le Pen and the far-right National Front are trying to capitalize on their good showing in the presidential race.
lead_paragraph: The fate of François Hollande’s young presidency rests largely on legislative elections that begin Sunday, as he seeks a large majority and the right tries to deny him one.

headline.seo: Parliamentary Elections in France Closely Watched by Hollande
headline.main: French Face a Battle to Control Parliament
headline.print_headline: French Face A Battle To Control Parliament
